mega.description: company moves to a new headquarters and spends £25 million on refurbishments
revealed a reduction in pre-tax profit from £115 million to £85 million and CFO resigns
the company announced a reduction of up to 320 store management roles across the business by the end of March
announced the largest loss in its history, a pre-tax loss of £491 million and the closure of up to 50 stores with the potential loss of 4,000 jobs  ( complete closure of stores )

medium.description: Henricks opened a few test pop-up stores across the country.
Henriks collaborates with a local charity for a community outreach program.
Henriks launches a social media campaign to engage with its online audience.
Product recall affecting its athletic wear line.
Supply chain disruptions cause delays in product shipments.
Economic downturn leads to reduced consumer spending.
